intro: Terebinthus attenuata, commonly known as the narrowleaf terebinth, is a shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces a resinous sap, which has been historically used in traditional medicine and as a source of turpentine. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
